tag-1: Citi Foundation and Centre Mohammed VI de Soutien Ã  la Microfinance Solidaire Honor Women Micro-entrepreneurs in Morocco
tag-2: Casablanca – The Citi Foundation recently participated in the second edition of the National Awards for Micro-entrepreneurship organized by Centre Mohammed VI de Soutien à la Microfinance Solidaire and Fédération Nationale des Associations de Microcrédit (FNAM), along government representatives, microfinance stakeholders and key industry partners, both private and public.
tag-3: This year, the Citi Foundation supported 14 women micro-entrepreneurs at the National Awards for Micro-entrepreneurship. These women micro-entrepreneurs were honored and rewarded for their commitment and efforts to improve their socioeconomic situation, as well as the performance and impact of their microenterprises on the community. Winners were awarded in five categories: Innovation, Human Development, Best Female Micro-entrepreneur, Responsible Tourism and a Special Encouragement Award.
tag-4: "Citi is honored to be in partnership with Centre Mohammed VI de Soutien à la Microfinance Solidaire in 2013, in continuity of the Citi Micro-entrepreneurship Awards 'CMA' launched for the seventh year in Morocco. The CMA programs have been carried out globally by Citi Foundation since 2005, and today we have expanded and implemented these programs in 30 countries worldwide," said Walter Siouffi, Citi Country Officer for Morocco.
tag-5: Mr. Errami Youssef, Executive Director of the Centre Mohammed VI Support Microfinance Solidaire, said, "This award is an opportunity to celebrate and reward women micro-entrepreneurs for their commitment and hard work to improve their socioeconomic situation, and it is in the objective of ensuring sustainability of this action that the Center has relied on its partners' support, given the educational and social scope and the positive impact on beneficiaries. In this respect, Citi Foundation's expertise and commitment to micro entrepreneurship has elevated this event with various stakeholders at the regional and international level."
tag-6: The National Awards for Micro-entrepreneurship was launched in 2012 by Centre Mohammed VI de Soutien à la Microfinance Solidaire in partnership with FNAM as part of the first International Symposium of Microfinance organized in October of the same year.
tag-7: A genuine representation of Microcredit in Morocco, this award aims to reward, promote and highlight micro-entrepreneurs who have distinguished themselves in their fields of action while significantly improving their living conditions through the creation or development of income generating activities.
